adjective.description: Of the color between green and orange in the spectrum, a primary subtractive color complementary to blue; colored like ripe lemons or egg yolks.

examples: he'd better get back there quick and prove he's not yellow

adjective.description: (of a book or newspaper) unscrupulously sensational.

examples: the craft detonated in a blaze of red and yellow
a wide range of colours from rich vibrant reds, yellows, blues, and greens to more unexpected pastel shades

noun.description: Any of a number of plant diseases in which the leaves turn yellow, typically caused by viruses and transmitted by insects.

examples: the cream paint was beginning to yellow

origin: Old English geolu, geolo, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch geel and German gelb, also to gold.
